#Text=Wikinews interviews a Restore the Fourth organizer
#Text=Wednesday , July 3 , 2013
#Text=A grassroots movement known as Restore the Fourth , dedicated to the protection of the 4th Amendment to the US Constitution , are to hold protests countrywide on July 4 .
#Text=The planned protests come in the wake of information about NSA surveillance leaked last month , notably the PRISM surveillance program and the collection of Verizon phone records .
#Text=Wikinews interviewed Jett , a national organizer from this recently created movement .
#Text=First of all , could you explain what Restore the Fourth is all about ?
#Text=At its core , RestoreTheFourth is about protecting citizens ' constitutional rights .
#Text=Specifically , we 're dedicated to bringing awareness and action to the expanding overreach and elimination of the 4th Amendment to the US Constitution .
#Text=Logo of the PRISM surveillance program .
#Text=Image : NSA , Adam Hart-Davis .
#Text=What is your role at Restore the Fourth ?
#Text=My job at RestoreTheFourth could be summarized as ' project coordinator ' .
#Text=Every person who wants to help can help in a tremendous way .
#Text=I simply make sure that their skills get used in a way that would be most beneficial to the movement : web development , public relations , etc.
#Text=I also field questions from the press and promote knowledge of our cause .
#Text=What are your plans for direct action , outreach , etc. ?

#Text=Our press release includes a list of ' demands ' for what we want to see in order to restore our privacy rights , including reform of the PATRIOT Act and increased accountability for public officials .
#Text=In the very short term , these protests and demonstrations bring awareness to the issue , something that 's really important in enacting reform .
#Text=In the long term , however , we expect to create a legal organization dedicated to restoring these rights inherent to every American .
#Text=By partnering with various other organizations that share our moral values , we can further these goals .
#Text=On July 4 , we will have over 100 protests in all 50 states , showing that the citizens of America are truly serious about protecting their rights .
#Text=By what means do you hope to achieve such change ?
#Text=This movement started only a few weeks ago , and since then we 've experienced exponential growth and progress .
#Text=Since the movement is still very young , plans diverge in the long term on what we hope to achieve .
#Text=Personally , I 'd like to see a combination of legislative and litigative action ( something like what the ACLU does ) , and others want to see further plans of action .
#Text=With organizations such as the BORDC , stopwatching . us and the EFF behind us , I feel that we can achieve all of this and much more .
#Text=HAVE YOUR SAY
#Text=What do you think is the right balance between surveillance and privacy ?
#Text=Add or view comments
#Text=Is the movement US-only or will it extend to other jurisdictions as well ?
#Text=Do you think it would be fair for the US to spy on non-citizens ?
#Text=I believe that rights are inherent to all humans , not only United States citizens .
#Text=In the long term I 'd certainly like to see people of all nations protected from the slow elimination of privacy that we 're all experiencing .
#Text=He 's [ Edward Snowden ] being treated as a ' martyr ' of sorts .
#Text=It seems to distract from what he truly believed in .
#Text=— Jett
#Text=What do you think about Edward Snowden 's whistleblowing ?
#Text=I think that too much attention is being given to his personality instead of what he fought for .
#Text=He 's being treated as a ' martyr ' of sorts .
#Text=It seems to distract from what he truly believed in — transparency for the government and inherent privacy for all Americans .
#Text=What do you think about his future , given the legal grey zone in which he currently is ?
#Text=Hard to say .
#Text=He may be captured by any number of agencies , or he may live a free man .
#Text=Whatever happens , he has the eyes of millions of people on him , all of whom will yell very loudly if anything occurs .
#Text=Thank you very much for your time .
#Text=Thanks for the opportunity .
